SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.smtp.security

Class ProxyMatcher

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.smtp.security.ProxyMatcher
public class ProxyMatcher extends Object
Utility class for matching emails against proxy rules.

Supports regex matching for IP addresses and SMTP verb values (EHLO, MAIL, RCPT).

This class is thread-safe and designed to work with config auto-reload.

  • Method Details

    • findMatchingRule

      public static Optional<ProxyRule> findMatchingRule(String ip, String ehlo, String mail, String rcpt, boolean isInbound, ProxyConfig config)
      Finds the first matching proxy rule for the given connection/envelope.

      This method creates a new matcher instance on each call to support config auto-reload.

      If multiple rules match, only the first match is returned and warnings are logged for subsequent matches.

      Parameters:
      ip - The IP address (can be null).
      ehlo - The EHLO/HELO domain (can be null).
      mail - The MAIL FROM address (can be null).
      rcpt - The RCPT TO address (can be null).
      isInbound - true if the session is inbound, false if outbound.
      config - The proxy configuration.
      Returns:
      Optional containing the first matching rule, or empty if no match.

    • matchesRule

      private static boolean matchesRule(String ip, String ehlo, String mail, String rcpt, boolean isInbound, ProxyRule rule)
      Checks if the provided values match a single rule. All specified patterns in the rule must match for the rule to match.
      Parameters:
      ip - The IP address.
      ehlo - The EHLO/HELO domain.
      mail - The MAIL FROM address.
      rcpt - The RCPT TO address.
      isInbound - true if the session is inbound, false if outbound.
      rule - The rule to match against.
      Returns:
      true if all patterns in the rule match, false otherwise.

    • matchesPattern

      private static boolean matchesPattern(String value, String pattern)
      Checks if a value matches a regex pattern.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to check (can be null).
      pattern - The regex pattern to match against.
      Returns:
      true if the value matches the pattern, false otherwise.
